title: Is Frank Ocean gay or bisexual? - Quora

response.answer_text: Personally, I think he's neither. This is the post on his tumblr, in which he "came out".Link: http://frankocean.tumblr.com/post/26473798723  However, when you read the post, all it says is that 4 years prior to coming out, he had a relationship with a man, he was in love with him, and that it has influenced some of the music he's written - he never came out as gay or bisexual. Even in interviews since he wrote that post, Like his GQ interview, (http://www.gq.com/entertainment/music/201212/frank-ocean-interview-gq-december-2012) He doesn't specifically say whether he's gay or bisexual:  "I'll respectfully say that life is dynamic and comes along with dynamic experiences, and the same sentiment that I have towards genres of music, I have towards a lot of labels and boxes and sh*t. As a writer, as a creator, I'm giving you my experiences. But just take what I give you. You ain't got to pry beyond that. I'm giving you what I feel like you can feel."  The way I see it, is like this: Frank Ocean once had a relationship with a man. Having a relationship with a man doesn't inherently make you gay or bisexual. But that relationship is an important part of his life, and he's choosing not to hide it.

If he hasn't labeled himself, we shouldn't presume to assign him a label. It's his lived experience - it's up to him to identify (or not) as he pleases and we should respect that. As an aside, I believe that the system that demands that individuals define their sexuality using set 'boxes' is inherently oppressive, and by refusing to follow that paradigm he is doing a really positive thing. He's subverting the system and showing that assuming that individuals must fall into one of very few externally imposed identities is a fundamentally flawed way of thinking.
